channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Mini-QE, US version
item.description: One thing that caught the market’s attention last week was the sudden spike in the Fed’s balance sheet, effectively reserving the amount achieved by QT since last November: There has been much debate about whether this signals the end of QT, and perhaps the beginning of the next round of QE. However, I think there is little point of debating whether this is ‘QE’ or not. By definition, this is definitely not QE; however, it is useful to think about how this will affect the fund flows.
